Complete this checklist before submitting your research paper.

## Project Requirements

### Paper Content (6,000-8,000 words)
- [ ] Title page with title, author name, and affiliation
- [ ] Abstract (150-250 words)
- [ ] Introduction (~1,500-2,000 words)
- [ ] Literature Review (~2,000-2,500 words)
- [ ] Methods section (~800-1,000 words)
- [ ] Results section (~500-800 words)
- [ ] Discussion section (~1,000-1,500 words)
- [ ] References (APA format, auto-generated by Quarto)

### Empirical Requirements
- [ ] One original survey with N=100+ responses
- [ ] Survey data exported and cleaned in R
- [ ] Two Research Questions (RQs) and/or Hypotheses (RHs) clearly stated
- [ ] Statistical analysis performed in RStudio
- [ ] Two APA-formatted data visualizations (tables/figures)

### Citation Requirements
- [ ] 15-20 academic, peer-reviewed sources
- [ ] All citations in APA 7th Edition format
- [ ] Zotero + BibTeX setup (references.bib)
- [ ] No uncited claims or paraphrases

### Writing & Formatting
- [ ] Consistent heading levels and formatting
- [ ] Active voice used throughout
- [ ] Past/present tense used appropriately
- [ ] No contractions or informal language
- [ ] Spell-checked and proofread
- [ ] Page numbers on all pages
- [ ] Double-spaced (or per your instructor's requirements)

## Technical Requirements

### RStudio Project
- [ ] Project organized in RStudio
- [ ] `research_paper.qmd` file with proper YAML header
- [ ] `references.bib` file with all citations
- [ ] `apa.csl` file (APA citation style)
- [ ] `/data` folder with cleaned survey data
- [ ] `/output` folder with final PDF

### Quarto Document
- [ ] YAML header includes:
  - [ ] `title:` (your full title)
  - [ ] `author:` (your name)
  - [ ] `bibliography: references.bib`
  - [ ] `csl: apa.csl`
  - [ ] `format: pdf`
- [ ] All R code chunks functional and properly documented
- [ ] No missing dependencies or package errors

### Rendering
- [ ] Document renders to PDF without errors
- [ ] PDF is readable and properly formatted
- [ ] All figures and tables appear correctly
- [ ] Citations and bibliography are properly formatted
- [ ] Page numbers visible in PDF

## GitHub Repository

### Repository Setup
- [ ] Private GitHub repository created
- [ ] Repository named descriptively (e.g., `grad-research-paper-f25`)
- [ ] README.md file explains the project
- [ ] All team members have access (if collaborative)

### Repository Contents
- [ ] All RStudio project files included
- [ ] `research_paper.qmd` file committed
- [ ] `references.bib` file committed
- [ ] `/data` folder with cleaned survey data
- [ ] `/output` folder with final PDF
- [ ] `.gitignore` configured to exclude unnecessary files

### Git Workflow
- [ ] Regular commits made throughout project
- [ ] Commit messages are clear and descriptive
- [ ] All changes pushed to remote repository
- [ ] No uncommitted changes at submission time

## Submission

### Blackboard
- [ ] Final PDF uploaded to Blackboard submission link
- [ ] PDF is the most current version of your paper
- [ ] Submission made before deadline

### GitHub Link
- [ ] GitHub repository link provided in Blackboard submission
- [ ] Link is accessible and points to correct repository
- [ ] Repository is private with appropriate access controls

### Final Deliverables
- [ ] Repository includes a clear `README.md`
- [ ] No sensitive data or personal information in the repository
- [ ] All files properly committed and pushed
- [ ] GitHub link and PDF both submitted

## Before You Hit Submit

- [ ] Read your paper one last time
- [ ] Check APA formatting (Purdue OWL can help)
- [ ] Verify all citations are correct
- [ ] Ensure all figures and tables have captions
- [ ] Make sure your PDF renders cleanly
- [ ] Get feedback from a peer (optional but recommended)
- [ ] Ask your instructor if you have questions

## Common Issues to Watch For

- ❌ Missing citations or incomplete references
- ❌ Inconsistent APA formatting
- ❌ Broken links or missing files in GitHub
- ❌ Missing data visualizations
- ❌ Unformatted tables or figures
- ❌ Rendering errors in Quarto
- ❌ Word count too short or too long

## Questions?

If something doesn't work:
1. Check the [Troubleshooting Guide](../troubleshooting/troubleshooting.html)
2. Review the [Graduate Technical Guide](grad-technical-guide.html)
